report:
Good afternoon, Beast fans,

What a day it turned out to be. Comfortable temps, just a soft breeze, great visibility, and wall-to-wall terrain made for a fantastic President’s Day on snow. We’re rolling right through holiday week with prime midwinter conditions across the most open terrain in the East.

Temperatures continue to moderate tonight, holding in the 20s, and tomorrow will bring mostly cloudy skies with highs in the mid to upper 20s up top and low 30s at the base. Winds will be on the lighter side, generally 10–15 mph out of the west. There’s a chance for light, showery precipitation during the day, mainly snow, with a brief mix possible at lower elevations. Nothing impactful, and the slightly warmer temps should help surfaces soften up nicely through the afternoon.

Snow surfaces remain in a really good place. Groomed terrain continues to offer that smooth, carve-friendly packed powder feel, with a few isolated slick spots here and there. With moderating temps, expect a little more give under your edges tomorrow while still holding onto that classic Beast bite.

Our grooming team is sticking with the same plan as last night with a few adjustments. Lower Double Dipper, Downdraft, and Lower Pipe Dream will come off the grooming plan, so those areas may start to bump up for anyone looking to mix in some natural terrain. Superstar has been added to the grooming lineup as crews begin flattening out the snowmaking whales while continuing to build toward spring. Just a reminder, Launchpad as it crosses Superstar, will be for advanced skiers and riders only again tomorrow due to snowmaking efforts. If you're looking to plan your day tomorrow, check out our Lifts & Trails Report for all the latest.

Snowmaking operations are currently on hold with the warmer temperatures. If colder weather returns later this week, we could see guns fire back up. If you’re curious to learn more about snowmaking and the natural challenges our crew has faced this winter, take a look at our most recent Insider Blog.

Tomorrow, lifts are scheduled to spin at 9:00 a.m., with the South Ridge Quad opening at 10:00 a.m. In addition to our regular Tuesday lineup, lifts like the Bear Mountain Quad, South Ridge Quad, and Canyon Quad will be running, giving you even more terrain to explore.

Looking ahead, there are multiple additional chances for snow later this week and into the weekend, enough to keep things fresh as we move deeper into February.

The Tubing Park presented by bubly remains open daily from 10:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m.

Over in kparks, the lineup stays stacked. Dream Maker is firing with 21 features between the upper and lower sections, The Stash remains fully in play with its wooden and stone features plus natural hits in the woods, Timberline continues to shine with 45 features and a halfpipe, and Easy Street, Lil’ Stash, and Vale Yard are all dialed.

Another strong stretch of winter at The Beast. We’ll see you out there.

-Josh

How are we Beast Fam? 

A gorgeous bluebird day on the slopes was just what we needed. This weekend has been a blast so far and we’re still firing into Presidents Day. This is winter at Killington in its prime as 100% of our trails are open to shred and we are leading the East in terrain. 

Expect a mostly cloudy day on Washington’s Birthday, with a slight chance of snow showers early tomorrow morning before things settle in. Temps will top out near 30° at the base and 23° near the top, with a steady south wind around 10–15 mph. It’s classic Vermont conditions so get after it.

Despite the beautiful sun beating down on the mountain and perfect temps keeping us happy, the quality of our snow surfaces has not taken a hit at all. Devils Fiddle has been on point and I’ve heard some say it was their run of the year so far. Now that’s some seriously good shredding. You obviously can't go wrong with the terrain at Bear Mountain, and Skyeburst is a great run to cruise on just nearby. All of our lifts will be running tomorrow with key lifts starting to spin at 8:00 a.m. Head over to South Ridge for a sweet morning cruise down Pipe Dream, prime for lapping when the South Ridge Quad starts spinning at 9:00 a.m.

Our grooming team is after it again, covering 96 trials with flush corduroy. They’ll be tackling the same plan minus Outer Limits which will be skiing on natural tomorrow. Groomers are still skiing incredibly well so pick your choice from the Lifts & Trails Report and have a blast carving it up. Some of my favorite picks are Bunny Buster and Double Dipper for those money turns. 

Our snowmaking crews will be lighting up snowguns around the K-1 base area and lower Superstar, with spot guns on the middle of Snowdon. Most of Devils Fiddle will be coming offline besides the bottom section which will get some more attention after temps required a break. The snow can be variable near snowmaking so please take note of that when skiing & riding near those areas. If you are curious to learn more about snowmaking and the natural challenges our crew has faced this winter, take a look at our most recent Insider Blog.  

A quick note related to snowmaking: the whales on Superstar are getting quite large, and skiing & riding on Launch Pad across Superstar is currently for expert skiers and riders only. If you want an easier cruising route, follow our Peak to Creek emblems on our trail signs and stay on Bear Trax. 

Over in kparks, the lineup remains stacked. The Tubing Park presented by bubly will open at 10:00 a.m. and will run until 6:00 p.m. this week, offering another great way to keep the fun going off the slopes.

We’re still rolllin’ and I’ll see you out there!

What’s up, Beast fans? 

Tomorrow is Valentine’s Day, and we’re happy to be feeling the love from Mother Nature as of late. After 14” of snow in the last week, we’ve been treated to sunny blue skies for the last two days, and this weekend’s forecast is calling for both some sun and some snow. It’s shaping up to be a gorgeous weekend at The Beast, full of winter games watch parties and fantastic turns on our 100% open terrain. 

The weather tomorrow looks friendly, with highs around 27° at the base and close to 20° at the peak. Winds will stay pretty calm at the base and will gust a little bit higher at the top of lifts, but nothing out of the ordinary there. We’ll see mostly cloud cover with some snow showers looking to roll through during the day. Friendly reminder that our Bear Mountain Quad is slated to open at 7:30 a.m. tomorrow for anyone looking to get first tracks! 

Snow conditions have continued to be excellent of late and tomorrow should be no different. Cover is holding up nicely in the woods while groomers have been top-notch. If you want to find a good line no matter what, head to one of our wide cruisers—Cruise Control, Upper Double Dipper, and Needles Eye always deliver the goods. Upper Pipe Dream was also excellent today, and Outer Limits was a fun challenge after it received a groom on Thursday night. By day’s end, conditions may start turning into loose granular near the center of busier trails, but there’s good snow to be found just about everywhere you look.  

Our grooming team is tackling an ambitious plan tonight, upping our groomed trail count to almost 100 heading into tomorrow! A few highlights: essentially all our trails in the Canyon are getting groomed, as well as all of Ovation, Field Goal, and Racer’s Edge (if time allows). Old Superstar and Touchdown saw a groom last night, but conditions on both are holding up just fine heading into tomorrow. For the full rundown, take a look at our Lifts & Trails Report.  

On the snowmaking front, our plan is to keep the snowguns on Devil’s Fiddle, Superstar, and certain spot guns largely around our base areas through Sunday night/Monday morning. Shout out (as always) to our snowmaking team for lighting up Devil’s Fiddle once again this season! While you may not see much snowmaking in other places, we’re still running comfortably over 100 snowguns here in mid-February. Interested to know why making snow has been doubly hard this season even though it’s been so cold? Check out our latest Insider Blog.  

A quick note related to snowmaking: the whales on Superstar are getting quite large, and skiing & riding on Launch Pad across Superstar is currently for expert skiers and riders only. If you want an easier cruising route, follow our Peak to Creek emblems on our trail signs and stay on Bear Trax.

Rest up and get after it tomorrow!

Evening, Beast family,

The mountain is skiing unbelievably well right now, with another 4 inches stacking up overnight giving every trail a refresh. We’ve got a killer weekend ahead with beautiful weather, Olympic watch parties, and top-tier turns all coming together for an unmatched scene. Vertigo Headwall came online today, pushing us to 100% open and keeping us leading the East in shredable terrain.

Friday is shaping up to be a bluebird beauty. Expect mostly sunny skies with temps topping out around 21° at the base and 14° up top. A steady west wind will keep things feeling a bit chillier but don’t worry, the sunshine will make those turns feel that much sweeter.

The snow surfaces have been delivering the goods recently with soft turns and super fun packed powder all over. There are still powder stashes to be found and our groomers have been perfect for laying down deep arcs. Check out Needles Eye for that nice packed powder or Stitch Line for something more challenging that has been skiing and riding really well. Another great option is Superstar which has fun snow if you aren’t afraid to ski under the guns. 

Our grooming team will be laying down corduroy on many of the same trails and switching it up a little by adding Downdraft, Pipe Dream, Old Superstar, Sassafras, and Outer Limits. Get over to Cruise Control for nice morning carves or to Outer Limits if you're craving a steeper pitch. By midday, expect groomed terrain to ski soft and playful, while ungroomed trails, trees, and bumps stay filled in and smooth thanks to another natural refresh. 

Our snowmaking crews switched gears today and got the guns firing on Devils Fiddle. They'll keep things running on Superstar, Skyehawk, and Mouse Trap and stick to this plan until Sunday. After spreading efforts across key terrain and refreshing surfaces, they have pulled off a lot of work to get things going on Devils Fiddle. It’s rare to see that trail get action so shoutout to our crews for making it happen. While others start winding things down, The Beast keeps the throttle down, charging ahead and leading the pack in snowmaking firepower. If you want to learn more about our snowmaking, check out the Insider Blog. 

Over in kparks, the lineup remains stacked. Dream Maker is firing with 21 features between the upper and lower sections, The Stash remains fully in play with wooden and stone features plus natural hits in the woods, Timberline continues to shine with 45 features, five jumps, and a halfpipe, Easy Street Progression Park has 10 features, and Lil’ Stash is open with three jumps, a tree jump, and a wall ride.

Get ready for a banger weekend!
